descriptionProfile: Former National Geo Picture editor and photographer. Here because of a photography obsession.
Former National Geo Picture editor and photographer. Here because of a photography obsession.

posts.description:
We only have one Earth. One Mother Nature. One home. We must seriously begin to pay attention: protect Her, support Her, fight for Her; do what we can to clean up our mess and not make new ones; do what we can to make sure we are not left without Her. Without Her, we we have no home. Our trash is real. Our gases are real. Our imprint is real, our mess is real--and She is not endless. Individuals matter-you matter, and you can affect change. Make one change this Earth Day....do it for your mother.

Sunset from Cat Island in the Bahamas -- an important migration wintering ground for and endangered songbird, where I was documenting the story for @audubonsociety magazine.  #earthday2017 #mothernature #sunset #catisland #onassignment #fieldwork #1frame4nature @ilcp_photographers @natgeocreative @world_wildlife #bestoftheday #nature_brilliance #nature #naturelovers #sunset #ocean #saveourseas #conservationphotography #earth #discoverearth #consciousness #landscape

Sometimes on assignment you don't always get what you want...in our search for another species of songbird-this one ended up flying in.  Meet the Bananaquit!  A resident of the Bahamas, this gorgeous little bird is widespread in the American tropics, and has even turned up in Florida at times!  Thank you @audubonsociety for a couple of new species to add to my songbird list! #wildlifephotography #wildlife_seekers #birding #birdsofinstagram #birds #songbird #natgeo @natgeocreative #onassignment @ilcp_photographers #catisland #bahamas @myoutislands @canonusa @tandemstock #best @smithsonian #fieldwork

It is theorized that perhaps the ladies prefer the bigger nosed guys, because with the bigger noses comes a bigger voice; perhaps lady Proboscis monkeys like louder men!? Either way, Proboscis monkeys are one of the largest species of monkey native to Asia. They travel in family groups, and as seen here, sexual dimorphism is quite pronounced. The males tend to have extremely large noses—some can reach over four inches long!  I spent over an hour enjoying these guys and their antics...and their noses!!
Labuk Bay Proboscis Monkey Sanctuary, Borneo #ngexpeditions #onassignment #primates #borneo #nose #bignose #instagram #instagood #bestoftheday #wildlife #wildlife_seekers #wildlifephotography @ilcp_photographers @natgeocreative @natgeotravel #natgeo #natgeotravel #labukbayproboscismonkeysanctuary @amazingborneo

A face only a mother (or a photographer) could love?!? I’ve spent the last twenty years going to the African bush….and to this day I still do not have an image of these cheeky birds that I’m satisfied with!! Helmeted Guinea Fowl, Tanzania.  #wildlife #wildlife_seekers #wildlifephotography #natgeo @audubonsociety @andbeyondngorongorocrater @natgeocreative @natgeo @canonusa #canon #canonusa  #birdsofinstagram #onlyamothercouldlove #tanzania #africa #ngorongoro @natgeotravel #onassignment #ngexpeditions

While looking for a file to print for a client I came across a near frame of this guy.  Beautiful, beautiful beast. #whitelion #nature #africa #onassignment #bigcats #photooftheday #1frame4nature #pride #southafrica #cannedhunting @ilcp_photographers @nature_org @tandemstock #wildlifephotography #wildlife_seekers #wildlife #natgeo

And sometimes you just have to bite 'em in the head.  Ngorongoro Crater, Tanzania.  #bestofthebest #bestoftheday #1frame4nature #tanzania @ilcp_photographers @natgeocreative @andbeyondngorongorocrater #wildlife_seekers #wildlifephotography #zebra #ngorongoro #fights #stripes #onassignment #africa #wildlifephotography #nature #wild

Rwanda is not only about gorillas.  It has an amazing variety of birds, and this Northern double-collared sunbird is one of them.  A spectacular specimen, barely the size of the palm of your hand! @natgeotravel @natgeocreative #natgeotravel #onassignment @natgeoexpeditions #instagood #wildlifephotography #wildlife_seekers #natgeo #birdsofinstagram #bird #sunbird @audubonsociety #audubon #rwanda #ilcp_photographers #1frame4nature @ilcp_photographers #bestoftheday #bestofthebest #africa #rwanda #birdsofafrica

There is no more humbling experience than to be in the presence of beasts so like ourselves; to watch them engage in behavior exactly like our own-to watch them laugh, spar, care for each other.  And then to realize that their existence would be so much better without ours. “Umubano” means ‘good relations.’ This critically endangered baby mountain gorilla is from the “Umubano” group of 13 individuals in Volcanoes National Park in Rwanda.  Ironically, tourism has actually saved these creatures, and their numbers, while still slight, are on the rise.  The experience to visit them is not to be missed.  Put it on your bucket list!! This is unfortunately the last stop on the National Geographic Wild Encounters wildlife trip!  Stay tuned for residual pictures….many thanks to @tiecotours for putting together such a wonderful trip and having such amazing people on the ground!! @natgeotravel @natgeocreative #natgeotravel #onassignment @natgeoexpeditions #instagood #rwanda #canonusa #conservation #wildlife #africa #gorillas #mountaingorilla #criticallyendangered @gorilladoctors @beautifulrwanda #natgeo #wildlife_seekers #wildlifephotography @savinggorillas @ceciliagallery

Humbled to be in their presence.  Ngorongoro Crater, Tanzania-stop number five on the National Geographic Wild Encounters wildlife trip.  About 20kms across, 600 meters deep and 300 sq kms in area, the Ngorongoro Crater is the largest un flooded and unbroken caldera in the world.  Stay tuned for the last destination!@natgeotravel @natgeocreative #natgeotravel #bestoftheday #wildlife_seekers #wildlifephotography @ilcp_photographers #tanzania #ngorongoro @andbeyondngorongorocrater #elephant #stoppoaching #babyanimals #africa #wildlife #conservation @ceciliagallery @canonusa  #canonusa

"None of us actually find a tiger-a tiger chooses to reveal itself to us." -Sandesh kadur 
India-Ranthanbore National Park is stop number four on the National Geographic Wild Encounters wildlife trip!  This is tiger T-91; a new male who has come to the area.  He's come into zone 3 and 4 and trying to claim the territory as his own. When we saw him he had a gash under his right leg-evidence of his fights with the resident tigers. 
Stay tuned for stop number five!! @natgeotravel @natgeocreative #natgeotravel #onassignment @natgeoexpeditions #instagood #tiger @tigerwatch #wildlife #wildlife_seekers #bestoftheday @ilcp_photographers @sandesh_kadur
